intro: Chamaefistula sinaloana, commonly known as the Sinaloan fiddlewood, is a shrub or small tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the Oleaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by small, spherical fruits. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in dry climates.
